Digit¶

harrison_functions.utils.std.digit.get_digit(number, n)¶

See: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/39644638/how-to-take-the-nth-digit-of-a-number-in-python


harrison_functions.utils.std.digit.digits_num_to_tuple(num, num_digits)¶
>>> digits_num_to_tuple(203, 3)
(3, 0, 2)

harrison_functions.utils.std.digit.digits_tuple_to_num(digits: tuple)¶
>>> digits_tuple_to_num((3, 0, 2))
203

harrison_functions.utils.std.digit.digitize(n, base=10)¶
Alternative to digits_num_to_tuple
See: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/1906717/splitting-integer-in-python
>>> tuple(digitize(203))
(2, 0, 3)
